title: Everest 2019: Chris Waller three Everest runners Yes Yes Yes, Arcadai Queen, Nature Strip
text:
Racing editor Ray Thomas, and the Off n Racing team Tony Thomas, and Matt Jones, go through the weekend races.

Sydney’s premier trainer Chris Waller will have three runners and Coolmore two chances in the $14 million The TAB Everest after it was confirmed brilliant three-year-old Yes Yes Yes has gained a start.

Waller said he has reached agreement with Coolmore, owners of Yes Yes Yes, to start their colt in the world’s richest turf race at Royal Randwick on October 19.

Yes Yes Yes joins stablemates Arcadia Queen (slot holders The Star) and Nature Strip (James Harron) in The Everest.

Coolmore now has two runners in The Everest with their Irish sprinter, the Aidan O-Brien-trained Ten Sovereigns, being prepared for next week’s big race.

“It’s exciting for Coolmore because we have two outstanding colts trained by the very best in Chris Waller and Aidan O’Brien,’’ Coolmore Australia supremo Tom Magnier said.

“The Everest is already a stallion-making race that has wide international appeal. Everyone knows about this race now.

“If either Yes Yes Yes or Ten Sovereigns can win The Everest, then they will eventually go to stud with the sort of hype that American Pharoah had when he was retired to stud in America.’’

Magnier said a rider for Yes Yes Yes is still being finalised while it is increasingly likely English superstar Ryan Moore will be in Sydney next week to ride Ten Sovereigns.

Waller said he is “thrilled to secure Yes Yes Yes as his runner” in The Everest.

“I have been incredibly pleased with what he has shown me over the past six weeks and am extremely confident he can acquit himself under weight-for-age conditions against an outstanding field of open age sprinters,” Waller said.

“Yes Yes Yes is an exceptional talent and I am eager to see him perform in The Everest.”

TAB Fixed Odds tightened Yes Yes Yes from $13 to $11 for The Everest which now has 11 confirmed starters including nine individual Group 1 winners.

Santa Ana Lane has firmed back into Everest favouritism at $4.60 just ahead of Pierata at $5, then Arcadia Queen at $6 with two-time defending champ Redzel at $9.

TAB’s representative, five-time Group 1 winner Santa Ana Lane, is currently the $4.60 favourite at TAB ahead of Pierata ($5) and Arcadia Queen ($6).

Redzel has won the first two editions of the TAB Everest and is presently a $9 chance.
